launchBrowser.progressText: Open the OpenBD Welcome Screen now?

stringParameter.name: tomcatuser
stringParameter.title: Tomcat Administrator Username
stringParameter.explanation: Tomcat includes a web interface that can be used to manage some aspects of your Tomcat server. Please enter the username that you would like to use to access that web based administrator.

stringParameter.name: tomcatpass
stringParameter.title: Tomcat Administrator Password
stringParameter.explanation: Now I need a password for the Tomcat Administrator...

stringParameter.name: tomcatport
stringParameter.title: Tomcat Port
stringParameter.explanation: What port number do you want Tomcat to listen to? This will be the port that you will use to access both Tomcat's Web Administrator and OpenBD's Web Administrator. If you're not sure what this is, just leave it set to it's default value.

throwError.text: Unable to bind to the given port number. Please select another one.

stringParameter.name: systemuser
stringParameter.title: Tomcat System User
stringParameter.explanation:
Enter in the System User Account that Tomcat will run under.
Running as "root" will avoid system permission problems, while running as a non-root user will add an additional layer of security. If you choose to run as a non-root user, we recommend using a easily identifiable username like "railo", "openbd", or "cfml".

stringParameter.name: openbdpass
stringParameter.title: OpenBD Administrator Password
stringParameter.explanation: OpenBD comes with a web-based administrator that allows you to control how your instance of OpenBD performs. Please enter a secure password that you will use to access your OpenBD Administrator below.

booleanParameter.name: startatboot
booleanParameter.title: Start At Boot?
booleanParameter.description: Yes, Start OpenBD at Boot Time
booleanParameter.explanation: Do you want OpenBD to start up automatically whenever the system boots up?

booleanParameter.name: installconn
booleanParameter.title: Install Apache Connector?
booleanParameter.explanation: The Apache connector is needed for most installs. The only time it is not needed is if you are not using Apache as your primary web server. If you're not sure what to do here, please install the connector.

choiceParameter.name: apachever
choiceParameter.title: Apache Version Number
choiceParameter.explanation: Please select the version of Apache that is running on your computer.

fileParameter.name: apachecontrolloc
fileParameter.title: Apache Control Script Location
fileParameter.explanation: Please enter the location of your apache control script. The default location for this script is "/etc/init.d/httpd" in CentOS and "/etc/init.d/apache2" in Ubuntu.

directoryParameter.name: apachemodulesloc
directoryParameter.title: Apache Modules Directory
directoryParameter.explanation: Please enter the directory that apache stores it's modules in. By default, this directory is located at "/usr/lib/httpd/modules/" for RHEL/CentOS, and "/usr/lib/apache2/modules/" for Ubuntu. For 64-bit systems, try changing the "lib" directory to "lib64".

fileParameter.name: apacheconfigloc
fileParameter.title: Apache Configuration File
fileParameter.explanation: The Apache configuration file controls how Apache processes incoming requests. The default location of the Apache configurtion file is "/etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf" on RHEL/CentOS and "/etc/apache2/apache2.conf" on Ubuntu.

directoryParameter.name: apachelogloc
directoryParameter.title: Apache Logs Directory
directoryParameter.explanation: Please enter the directory that apache stores it's log files in. By default, this directory is located at "/var/log/httpd/" for RHEL/CentOS, and "/var/log/apache2/" for Ubuntu. The installer needs this to properly install the Apache-Tomcat connector (mod_jk).

booleanParameter.name: installiis
booleanParameter.title: Install the IIS Connector?
booleanParameter.explanation: Do you want to install the IIS Connector? If you're unsure, leave this box checked.

choiceParameter.name: bittype
choiceParameter.title: Choose Bit Type
choiceParameter.explanation: Please verify the bit-type you're wanting to install. For example, even tough you may be running on a 64-bit server, under some circumstances you may need to install the 32-bit version of the Apache connector.
